sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: A sphere has a radius of 5 cm. What is the volume of the sphere in cubic centimeters?
message_2:
The volume V of a sphere can be calculated using the formula:

V = (4/3)πr³

where r is the radius of the sphere.

In this case, the radius r is 5 cm. Plugging this value into the formula, we get:

V = (4/3)π(5)³

V = (4/3)π(125)

V ≈ 4.18879 * 125

V ≈ 523.59878 cubic centimeters

So, the volume of the sphere is approximately 523.6 cubic centimeters.
